>Dec 16, 2007 6:29 PM, Kenneth Stanley <kstanley@...> wrote:
>
> Colin, are you sure that SharpNEAT flushes the network between the 4
>  input examples of XOR? I think I remember someone telling me that
>  there was a some kind of bug like that in the SharpNEAT XOR but I
>  could be remembering wrong.
>
>  Note that the issue is, if you don't flush between each example, the
>  network can succeed by memorizing the order of the examples, which is
>  not a true solution to XOR.
>
>  I may be mistaken about SharpNEAT not flushing, but it's still a good
>  issue to be aware of with any XOR experiment.

You may be thinking of ANJI. That happened with us when we first
implemented XOR.

Oh, look, it solved XOR...yay! Oh wait, the error is huge when we
randomize the input sequence. :)

--Derek
